segments.text: I see the woman by the sink, focused entirely on the plate she’s drying.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There’s water flooding over the edge of the sink, but she doesn’t seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe she’s just standing there with her foot in the puddle.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s almost as if she’s in her own little world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Meanwhile, the boy is climbing up the wobbly stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: My heart races thinking about what could happen if he falls.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is standing there, her arm reaching up and waiting for a cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to shout out to them, to tell them to be careful.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But I just watch, half-amused and half-worried.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful compared to the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's amazing to see how oblivious the woman is to everything around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There’s an impending sense of danger that hangs in the air.
segments.speaker: PAR
